headline: Mom's Favorite Baked Mac and Cheese
description: A creamy baked mac and cheese that is everything you want from a comforting, homemade, kid-pleasing mac and cheese recipe. Easy enough to make weekly.

video.description: This creamy baked macaroni and cheese has two kinds of cheese.
video.name: Mom’s Favorite Baked Mac and Cheese

name: Mom's Favorite Baked Mac and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package processed American cheese, cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Sauté onion for 2 minutes. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Then stir in milk, salt, mustard, and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until mixture boils and thickens.
Meanwhile, bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain.
Add Cheddar and American cheeses to milk mixture; stir until cheese melts.
Combine cheese sauce and macaroni in a 2-quart baking dish; mix well.
Bake in preheated oven until hot and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe, but I leave out the onions = sub a bit of onion & garlic powder in the cheese mix. Then at the end once it's in the casserole dish, sprinkle additional cheddar cheese on top for the crunchy browned topping I love.

I made this with modifications; I boiled the pasta with the onion in the water which I removed once the pasta cooked. Neither I nor my family is a big fan of American cheese, so I used Fontina instead. Other than those two modifications I followed the recipe and everyone said they would eat it again. Works for me

my now 16 yr old son has had this as his birthday meal for the past 3 years with gammon (baked ham) , he gets offered lots of other different choices, i.e go to a restaurant of his choosing, take away food or other favourites but its this everytime :-) we used soya milk in ours.

The kids loved this recipe! Made it for a Christmas dinner side. I didn't have any American cheese on hand, so we used Cheddar Jack along with the Sharp cheddar. Very creamy and cheesy! Added breadcrumbs on top for baking.

This is a very good base recipe which I was able to greatly enhance by doing the following: I doubled most of the ingredients and used 16 oz of large, ridged elbow macaroni, and prepared mustard in place of the dry. I doubled the amount of flour and butter, but I also added a tad bit more butter along with a small amount of finely chopped sweet red and green bell peppers, garlic, and onion powders, about

This is my usual method of making mac and cheese. The only difference is that I don’t add onion. The dish comes out cheesy and creamy every time. Be sure to not over cook the pasta. We prefer it without the onion, but it is still good.

I make this every Thanksgiving for my family, and they all love it. They don't love onion, though, so I just replace the actual onion with a sprinkling of onion powder. And it doesn't need breadcrumbs.
Very good
Tasted amazing. The whole family loved it. I just didn’t put onion in it.

Delicious!!! My family ate all of it. I did add a bit of sharp cheddar from the block, I think it has a bit more cheesy flavor. Also, added a bread crumb topping. My family doesn't think it's authentic baked mac & cheese without a topping! This is the best recipe I've tried.

It is a good basic recipe but I cannot understand why it has so many 5 star ratings. It was Ok; maybe people are used to the box kind of mac and cheese? Try using your favorite cheese that melts (and does not string) and try using some(not all) heavy cream or 1/2 & 1/2 . If you add the cracker/melted butter topping at the end(last 10 minutes) it will be a crowd pleaser. My husband likes me to put a layer of mac and cheese at the bottom of the dish, then add a thin layer of crumbled blue cheese and chopped up bacon and a light sprinkle of cayenne/red pepper. Add a top layer of mac and cheese and bake 15-20 minutes. Next layer on the cracker butter topping and cook around 10 more minutes. He loves it (I do not).
Other than swapping Gruyère for American I followed the recipe and the result was delicious. My family gobbled it up!
I make this often and everyone enjoys it. I omit the onion however and use white pepper to hide it from my young granddaughter. I also never bake it and use 12oz of elbows. There's plenty of sauce.

I just put this into the oven so I can’t review it properly. The sauce tastes great.
I doubled the pasta and added three smokies, cut in small pieces.
I have also covered it as my hubby likes lots of sauce and I didn’t want it to dry out.
No onions! Add seasoned bread crumbs.

This was really good. I used 3 cheeses. Cheddar, mozarella and american slices. I also add a higher amount of liquid ingredients. I baked it and it was probably the best mac and cheese I have made. I tried to upload a picture several times and resized it, etc but it won't upload so dont' really know how to do that.
Loved it!

I used this recipe for one of our catering jobs. Actually, I haven’t had Velvetta cheese since I was a kid, but what a great addition. Our client had requested Mac and cheese that had fried bacon and onion in it, so with a few minor prep changes, we came up with the creamiest, most delicious Mac and cheese I have had in a very long time! I chopped and fried the bacon, then sautéed the onions with it, drained them well, discarded the bacon grease, and continued with the recipe using butter to make the roux. Delicious! We will definitely be using this again both in catering, and at home!!
Added some broccoli to it for flavoring.

Delicious! Compliments from everyone. We multiplied the original recipe by six (except for the onion - we only added 1/4 cup despite increasing everything else); a total of 48 oz of noodles to fill two 9x13" baking dishes. Did not use the dry mustard because we didn't have any on hand. Used 50% sharp cheddar cheese (~8 cups), 30% Mexican blend cheese (~6 cups), and 20% mozzarella cheese (~3 cups). Baked covered for 30 minutes then 10 uncovered at 350 deg F with both pans side by side on middle rack. Did not add any bread topping. Enjoy!!
I chose not to add any onion, as I thought the flavor would dramatically change the taste of the dish as a whole. VERY delicious dinner option for a cold winter evening in!!
We loved this recipe as is with the chewy and crispy bits on the top! It was creamy underneath... and a great taste!
Like it very much
This was delicious.

My family said that this was the best homemade mac and cheese they've ever had. Very easy to put together and very adaptable with other cheeses or add-ins like a protein or vegetables. A hit at our house! Thank you.

Rather embarrassing, but I'm 66 & never made Mac & cheese from scratch. Just in time for Christmas, this recipe took me back to my grandmother's farm in Indiana during my childhood. Thank you for such a beautiful memory. This recipe is a keepre
This was great other than 8 ounces of elbow noodles wasn’t nearly enough for the sauce. Use the full 16oz box.

I made this recipe and followed the instructions as written with the only change of a little bit of cayenne pepper. I didn't care for the onion. The sauce turned out kind of grainy and I didn't care for it at all, and neither did my family. I found this recipe to be rather disappointing. If I made it again I would definitely change up the cheeses.

I added a little more mustard and garlic salt. Used aged white cheddar in place of half of American processed cheese and used only half of the processed cheese. I used sautéed onion as called for but added dry onion on the top before I baked it. This came out great! I will use this recipe again.

love this recipe. I've been making it for a few years now. The only change is I add more milk (1\2 to 1 cup) after mixing in the noodles. It helps from drying out while baking. The flavor is amazing and I always get a lot of compliments!
Very yummy and easy!
My go to recipe for Mac & cheese
This was the best! Everyone loved it! Made X3 putting slightly less cheese in and only half the processed cheese for 12 people. Delicious!
Great! I did put a few bread crumbs on top.

Was a huge hit at my friends party. Easy recipe with great results.

Will definitely make this again.

It reminded it me of the baked Mac and cheese I grew up on. It was creamy and cheesy and delicious!
I served with diced celery to give the dish the crunchy texture we love!
This is literally the best, I’ve made it on multiple occasions for about 2 years now and every time I make it for a guest they ask to take some leftovers home.

Perfect baseline recipe. Throw in a dash or 2 of nutmeg and chefs kiss. I usually double the recipe when I make it so I use sharp cheddar and mozzarella and instead of double the velveta the second double up is pepper jack cubes. Too spicy? Throw in a little more mustard ( I use actual mustard) to kinda balance it out. Can’t beat it.
I added a small portion of cubed spam to make a heartier meal. I doubled the recipe size so there were leftovers, so a whole can of Spam did not overwhelm the basic Mac & cheese
Great recipe. I substituted gluten free macaroni and used Boars Head white American and sharp cheddar. Yummmmmm

This is excellent, and was like the mac and cheese from my childhood. I loved the mustard and onions. I am a nurse and work odd over night shifts in these crazy times. This was good hot, this was good cold, this was good in my lunch three days old, lol It was comforting, and gave me some carbs as well as protein for long lasting energy. I only changed out the cheddar for swiss for one cup because that's what I had. It would be great as written
I've made this recipe a few times it is so yummy! It's even better if you add chopped up cooked bacon. There is usually no leftovers or I will double the batch and freeze some for a fast dinner.
I've made this three times in the last two weeks because my daughter LOVES it. I'm not the biggest cheese fan, and even I love it!
I doubled this recipe, and added more shredded cheddar cheese and bacon bits to the top before baking. Very creamy and good.
Followed exact directions and everyone loved it! Will make again

I made this recipe with a few modifications.

I added 1 1/4 lb ground beef with the sauteed onion.

The sauce I used the recipe, but added a little more milk, some velvetta and some Colby Monterey Jack.

Before baking I added a layer of shredded cheddar and crushed ritz crackers with melted butter.

Turned out fantastic.

This was yummy! I added in a dash of dried parsley and a dash of Worchestire sauce and some extra salt, before I even tried the original recipe. I also used almond milk and a mixture of white cheddar and ground parmesean. You have to do with what you have :D But it didn't disappoint.
I used large shells for the macaroni. My husband said it was his favorite!

This is a no-holds-barred style of mac and cheese. Delicious, creamy and very filling. Not a dish for health-conscience people. I increased the recipe by 50 percent, which was not necessary given how filling this dish is. When cooking, be careful that you have a large enough saucepan to hold all the ingredients. This recipe holds its own as a main dish but would work just as well as a side.

Pros: creamy, cheesy, filling, fairly easy to make

Cons: salty, may be too heavy for some. I had one serving (I'm a big guy) and that was plenty. I would like to find a way to cut the salt down. Then I think it would rate five stars.

This is the best mac and cheese recipe I have come across. Being on quarantine for the past seven weeks, we have made it quite a few times! I have been teaching my 10 year old to cook a few things, working on measuring ingredients and this has been her favorite creation by far. Thanks!
Best baked mac & cheese dish I've ever had. It really comes out creamy and not "curdled" or sticky like most bakes do. Have made this for several occasions and it's a hit every time.
In search for a home style Mac and cheese, this recipe will for sure be in our favorites. We followed the recipe exactly with no adjustments, and turned out great. Highly recommend, thank you.
I added sliced hotdogs simply delicious. My husband loved it.
This saved me tonight. Covid-19. Husband on meds for diverticulitis. Needed bland food. Used what cheese I had and added orange cheddar powder. Bless you!
a keeper! I didn't have the American cheese so substituted Gouda - it was still tasty, would've liked it to be stronger tasting.

I made this for my family, and they absolutely loved it. Barely any left. I will make it again this week!! The taste is amazing. I cooked a little longer to get it more golden on top and less runny! perfect, depends on your preference!
Delicious!!!

Easy to make. I didn't use onion because my son can't stand onions. I also had some provolone cheese on hand so I threw about 6 slices in there, too. I doubled the recipe and didn't have dry mustard so I just squirted some yellow mustard in it. No, I didn't measure it but I'm guessing it was about 2 tablespoons. The only thing it is missing is a good topping. Was a big hit for a group of 7!
Super easy to make and tastes great
I added a little Worcester sauce and a little hot sauce . Substituted dry mustard with Dijon. Will definitely make again
Fantastic! Made it exactly as is stated in the recipe (save I used ziti instead of elbows) and family loved it.
The recipe is delicious exactly as written. I'm confused by the reviewers who think Velveeta is in the recipe. There is no Velveeta cheese in this recipe!

I made this as written and it did come out a little dry despite being covered for the beginning of the cooking period as suggested by the reviewers. I still liked it a lot though, the cheese flavor is great and it heated up well the next day for leftover with a little milk to soften it. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

Great Foundation for a homemade Mac and cheese. I don’t do the onions and dry mustard. Keep it simple. The additions for me are Pre cooked Bacon that I chop up and put in the cheese mix and I crumble Ritz crackers and sprinkle on top prior to baking.
This was a bit at our family Thanksgiving! I used medium cheddar instead of sharp and I topped it with Panko bread crumbs. This one is a keeper!!
I used cutoff ends of cheese that my local supermarket deli packages up. It adds a bit of surprise as to the end flavor because the mix of ends is often times quite varied.

I made this for our robotics team. So I made 22 servings, it's a lot! I used 'cheese ends' from the deli that I had purchased and froze some time ago. Which means there was a variety of cheeses. This makes it tastes so good!
Even reheated this Mac is creamy
This has become a favorite for our family! Easy to make and delicious. We omit the onion because of family preference, but great recipe!
Turned out really good. Had to improvise a little being some of the ingredients were not available. Either way it was pretty simple and fool proof. Thank you for sharing it.
I added some bread crumbs to the top but this recipe is awesome!!! Very yummy!!!
Nummy!!!!!

love it just cut back on milk I uses 1 cup instead of 2 and it was enough 2 cups would have made it tooo soupy for me and I only uses 8 oz of pasta ..but flavor was really good sharp cheese and the Colby and japaneo GOOD. Oh yeah I left onion out, because everyone said it overpowers . but still very good
Great recipe! Easy to follow and perfect ratio of cheese to mac. The only thing is...I saw a review that mentioned to leave out the onion so I did and i’m glad I did. DON’T ADD ONION.

It was so nice! As a mini-chef, I really enjoyed experiencing this recipe. Although we made to many cheese sauce, and we ended up having to make more elbow macaroni to save the drowning ones. Either way, you should make this recipe yourself! It was very appealing, and fattening.Yum!

Hmm, might be mom's favorite but not sure how many kids would want the onion. The onions and flour taste over power it. If I decided to try this one again I'd leave out the onion and cut down the flour.
Best Mac and cheese recipe!! Just made it for Thanksgiving dinner and everyone raved about it. Thanks for the recipe!!
Came out amazing! And I doubled the recipe, baked Mac j cheese is a staple for holidays!

Very yummy. It was very good and the sauce was very creamy. The Mac and Cheese can be cut like cake out of your pan. It is very, very, very, filling. My whole family loved it when I made it for them. They were like, "How could a nine year old make good food?". Defenitly one of my favorite recipes, other than Annies.
This is the best homemade mac and cheese I have found. The onions make the dish. My kids beg for this and have no idea there are onions in it. This is a total hit at my house!
I added dry mustard and italian herbs; no onion.

I get requests for "my" famous mac and cheese at every gathering. I've made it several times and have tried the original recipe and several of the more popular changes. I think most are really good. The white cheddar option was my least favorite. This is a must have recipe in your cooking arsenal.
Very good! It looked like too much cheese sauce but it turned out to be the correct amount!
First time making Mac and cheese sauce. It turned out great!!
Made it as directed. Super easy and delicious.
Skipped on the onion, used only cheddar cheese and doubled the size. Came out tastyyyy.
Mixed in some bread crumbs.

Husband Loved it!! I've tried other Mac and cheese recipes, didn't really care for them, especially my Husband who happens to be a picky eater. 
I did some tweaking, instead of using the type of cheese that called for 2 cups, I used instead 1 cup of Finely Shredded Italian Cheese. For the other kind of cheese, I used 1 cup of Shredded Sharp Cheese. I also used a few shakes of Grated parmesan cheese. Put in a couple of shakes of Worcestershire. 
Used a Red onion instead, green seems to us too strong. 
To top it off, after putting the finished product in a casserole dish, I had poured enough extra milk on top and a few more shakes of parmesan cheese. We like our Mac and cheese, well at least my Husband does, a little bit more moist,. I put it the oven for One hour and 10 to 15 minutes longer. I found out if in oven for 15 minutes longer, for us it comes out perfect. It may look dry, but it's not. Also by using less cheese, it's not over powering.
I made this for a family dinner. Everyone loved it but it wasn’t creamy enough for me. I made it again and left out the eggs, much better.
Easy to make and add my favorite ingredients. I used Italian meatballs.
This recipe was great, I did add 2 eggs to my mix and it was truly amazing. I will definitely be making this again.
I'm a college student so I haven't done much cooking. It was pretty easy if a little time-consuming. I'm planning to freeze the leftovers so I hope that it takes just as good reheated.
All my kids loved it! It had a great flavor I just didn't really care for the texture.

I highly recommended this recipe! I did swap the cheeses and omitted the onion. I double the recipe and used 1 block of white extra sharp cheddar, 1 block of yellow extra sharp cheddar and 1 block of Colby. Everyone had seconds and filled their containers with left overs at the end of the night. Next time I am going to swap the Colby out for smoked Gouda or Gruyere.

My husband and I absolutely loved this! In regards to the person who thought it was too oniony, I am guessing that they didn’t cook the onions long enough as ours didn’t have an over the top onion flavor at all. All of the flavors blended perfectly together.
I made a few adjustments, using extra old cheddar and some parmesan. Topped with panko crumbs. I think I may have found the best mac & cheese recipe - my husband loved it!

This is so close to my granny’s recipe. I doubled the recipe, left out the onion, and used the tripe cheddar blend. When doing that- for the rue I added all the dry ingredients to 1 cup of milk and 4 tbsp of butter (since it was doubled), heated that until thickened and then added the remaining 2 cups of milk, 1 cup at a time waiting until it thickened to add more.
This is my go-to mac and cheese recipe. I usually double the recipe (and am very generous with the cheese, I like to use good quality extra sharp cheddar) and make it for the holidays.
